heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 11th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 09 September 2025 and has lasted 5 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 659 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.6 mm) and cloud levels (up 1123 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 658.5m lower than yesterday, 697.1m lower than the past week, 1122.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 939m and a high of 3180m, averaging 1127.8m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, humidity should not be a concern and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
